title: VERS test definition
description: Schema for Version Range Specifier tests definitions.

version_constraint.title: VERS version constraint
version_constraint.description: A VERS version constraint as two-tuple array of (comparator, version string).

vers_components.title: VERS decoded components
vers_components.description: Individual decoded VERS scheme and constraints to use as a test input or expected output.

version_constraints.title: Version constraints list
version_constraints.description: A list of version constraints as two-tuples of (comparator, version).

vers_test.title: VERS test
vers_test.description: A VERS test with input and expected output.

test_group.title: Test group
test_group.description: The group of this test like 'base' or 'advanced'.

meta:enum.base: Test group for base conformance tests for VERS building and parsing.
meta:enum.advanced: Test group for advanced tests to support flexible VERS building and parsing.

test_type.title: Test type
test_type.description: The type of this test like 'build' or 'parse'.

meta:enum.from_native: A VERS construction test from native ecosystem range data input from a data source to a canonical VERS string.
meta:enum.build: A VERS building test from decoded components to a canonical VERS string.
meta:enum.parse: A VERS parsing test from a VERS string to decoded scheme and constraints list.
meta:enum.roundtrip: A VERS roundtrip test, parsing then building back a VERS from a canonical string input.
meta:enum.merge: A VERS merging test from an array of VERS strings to a canonical VERS string.
meta:enum.containment: A VERS containment to test if a bare version string is contained in the range of a VERS string.
meta:enum.invert: A VERS inversion of a VERS string to a canonical VERS string.
meta:enum.comparison: A version comparison test to sort an input version strings array using the scheme rules.
meta:enum.equality: A version equality test to check if two input versions strings are equal using the scheme rules.

expected_failure.title: Expected failure
expected_failure.description: true if this test input is expected to fail to be processed.

expected_failure_reason.title: Expected failure reason
expected_failure_reason.description: The reason why this test is is expected to fail if expected_failure is true.

input.title: Input for conversion from native version range to VERS
input.description: An object with a data source and native version range data to use as conversion test from native data.

data_source.title: Data source for test input
data_source.description: A string (like a scheme or else) or URL that identifies the source of the data for this test input.

native_range.title: Input native version range
native_range.description: A native version range data that can be any of a string, array or object.

expected_output.title: Expected canonical VERS
expected_output.description: A canonical VERS string to use as a test ouput.

input.title: Input test VERS
input.description: A VERS string to use as a test input (canonical or not).

expected_output.title: Expected output decoded VERS components
expected_output.description: Test output as an object decoded VERS components.

input.title: Input decoded VERS components
input.description: Test input as an object of decoded VERS components.

expected_output.title: Expected canonical VERS
expected_output.description: A canonical VERS string to use as a test ouput.

input.title: Input test VERS
input.description: A VERS string to use as a test input (canonical or not).

expected_output.title: Expected canonical VERS
expected_output.description: A canonical VERS string to use as a test ouput.

input.title: Input list of VERS strings
input.description: Test input as a list of VERS strings.

expected_output.title: Expected canonical VERS
expected_output.description: An expected canonical merged VERS string to use as a test ouput.

input.title: Input for version containment
input.description: A version and a VERS string to use as a containment test input.

version.title: Input test version
version.description: A version string to for containment in the input VERS.

vers.title: Input test VERS
vers.description: A canonical VERS string used to test its containmant of the input version.

expected_output.title: True if the version is expected to be contained in the input VERS
expected_output.description: A true boolean if the version is contained in the input VERS or false otherwise.

input.title: Input for version comparison
input.description: A VERS scheme and a list of version strings to use as sorting test input.

versions.title: Input list of bare versions
versions.description: Test input as a list of bare versions strings.

expected_output.title: Expected sorted list of bare versions
expected_output.description: An expected sorted list of version strings to use as a test ouput.

input.title: Input for version equality
input.description: A VERS scheme and a two-tuple of version strings to compare.

versions.title: Input tuple of two bare versions
versions.description: Test input as a tuple of two  bare versions strings.

expected_output.title: True if two bare versions are expected to be equal
expected_output.description: A true boolean if two bare versions are expected to be equal to use as a test ouput.

input.title: Input test VERS
input.description: A VERS string to use as a test input (canonical or not).

input.title: Input VERS components
input.description: Test input as an object of decoded VERS components.

$schema.title: JSON schema
$schema.description: Contains the URL of the JSON schema for Version Range Specifier tests.

tests.title: Test suite
tests.description: A list of Version Range Specifier tests.
